“Fights begin and end with handshakes.” – Cameron Conaway
“You will never be entirely comfortable. This is the truth behind the champion – he is always fighting something. To do otherwise is to settle.” – Julien Smith
“There was no such thing as a fair fight. All vulnerabilities must be exploited.” – Cary Caffrey
“Wisdom is merely the movement from fighting life to embracing it.” – Rasheed Ogunlaru
“Where there is only a choice between cowardice and violence, I would advise violence.” – Mahatma Gandhi
“It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.” – Vince Lombardi
“Everyone has a plan until they’ve been hit.” – Joe Lewis
“Some Warriors look fierce, but are mild. Some seem timid, but are vicious. Look beyond appearances; position yourself for the advantage.” – Deng Ming-Dao
“The fight is won or lost far away from witnesses – behind the lines, in the gym, and out there on the road, long before I dance under those lights.” – Muhammad Ali
“All the war-propaganda, all the screaming and lies and hatred, comes invariably from people who are not fighting.” – George Orwell
“Victory is always possible for the person who refuses to stop fighting.” – Napoleon Hill
